metadata.Title: CVE-2013-0191 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
libpam-pgsql (aka pam_pgsql) 0.7 does not properly handle a NULL value returned by the password search query, which allows remote attackers to bypass authentication via a crafted password.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2013-0191` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libpam-pgsql - 0.7.3.1-4
No subscription required

criterions.comment: pam-pgsql package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '0.7.3.1-4').
